skill.name: analyzing-projects
skill.description: Analyzes codebases to understand structure, tech stack, patterns, and conventions. Use when onboarding to a new project, exploring unfamiliar code, or when asked "how does this work?" or "what's the architecture?"

skill.author: CloudAI-X

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill with no executable code. It provides structured instructions for analyzing codebases using standard Unix commands. No security risks identified.

content.user_title: Analyze Any Codebase with Structured Workflow
content.value_statement: Understanding unfamiliar codebases is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill provides a systematic approach to analyze project structure, identify tech stacks, and document architecture patterns.
actual_capabilities: Detects technology stack from package files and dependencies
Maps project structure with annotated directory trees
limitations: Requires manual execution of analysis commands
Cannot analyze binary or compiled code
Dependent on user providing accurate file paths
Limited to visible project files and directories

use_cases.title: Onboard to New Projects
use_cases.description: Quickly understand project structure, tech stack, and development workflow when joining a new codebase.

use_cases.title: Code Review Preparation
use_cases.description: Analyze unfamiliar repositories before code reviews to understand context and architectural decisions.

use_cases.title: Project Documentation
use_cases.description: Generate structured documentation for existing projects to help team members understand system architecture.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Project Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this project structure and tell me what type of application this is, what technologies it uses, and how it's organized.

prompt_templates.title: Tech Stack Detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Look at the package files and configuration to identify all the technologies, frameworks, and tools this project uses.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Map out the high-level architecture of this project. Show me the main components, how they connect, and the overall design pattern.

prompt_templates.title: Development Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Find and document all the development commands, build processes, testing setup, and deployment configuration for this project.

output_examples.input: Analyze this codebase and tell me what it does
output: RESTful API service for online store operations built with Node.js and Express.
Clean architecture with separation between controllers, services, and data access layers.

best_practices: Always start with README and documentation files for project context
Verify tech stack detection by checking multiple configuration files
Document assumptions and uncertainties in the analysis report
anti_patterns: Don't skip the validation checklist - it ensures analysis accuracy
Avoid making assumptions without evidence from the codebase
Don't ignore configuration files - they reveal important project details

faq.question: What types of projects can this analyze?
faq.answer: Works with any text-based codebase including web apps, APIs, libraries, and scripts in all major programming languages.

faq.question: How long does a typical analysis take?
faq.answer: Simple projects: 5-10 minutes. Complex enterprise applications: 20-30 minutes depending on size and complexity.

faq.question: Can it analyze private repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, if you have local access to the code. The skill works on any directory you can navigate to with standard commands.

faq.question: What if the project uses uncommon technologies?
faq.answer: The skill identifies common patterns but flags unknown configurations for manual investigation and documentation.

faq.question: Does it modify any project files?
faq.answer: No, this is a read-only analysis. It only examines files and generates reports without making any changes.

faq.question: How detailed should the analysis be?
faq.answer: Follow the 6-step workflow for comprehensive analysis, but adjust depth based on your specific needs and time constraints.
